definition: to leave one's mortal frame (idiom)/to die

sentences.english: The colonists massacred thousands of natives with brutal and callous force.
sentences.chinese: 殖民者惨绝人寰地屠杀了成千的土著居民。

sentences.english: Strength that comes from a waist impeded the casualty of this highly tragic catastrophe.
sentences.chinese: 一个来自腰间的力道阻止了这一惨绝人寰悲剧的发生。

sentences.english: When his wife died , the baby was two .
sentences.chinese: 他妻子撒手人寰时，他们最小的孩子才两岁。

sentences.english: When it became apparent that he wasn't going to survive, Tyler's mom talked to him about death.
sentences.chinese: 泰勒即将撒手人寰时，妈妈和他谈起死亡。

sentences.english: Japanese militarism once caused the very grave disaster to Asian people.
sentences.chinese: 日本军国主义曾经给人类带来惨绝人寰的灾难。

sentences.english: She left a husband and a baby.
sentences.chinese: 她撇下丈夫和孩子，撒手人寰。

sentences.english: It's one of the most terrible stories in history.
sentences.chinese: 这是历史上最惨绝人寰的事之一。

sentences.english: Otlet died in 1944, a broken man .
sentences.chinese: 1944年，奥特雷撒手人寰，身后萧条。

sentences.english: Flemingwas not to know that within five months he would be dead.
sentences.chinese: 弗莱明当时并不知晓自己在五个月后会撒手人寰。

sentences.english: A few days later my mother died of a massive heart attack.
sentences.chinese: 没想到几天后，母亲由于突发严重心脏病，撒手人寰。

definition: to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
so many that the bamboo slats have been exhausted/innumerable crimes (idiom)/see also 罄筆難書|罄笔难书[qing4 bi3 nan2 shu1]
to massacre everyone in a captured city
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
incomparable/none to compare with at that time

national humiliation, refers to Japanese incursions into China in the 1930s and 40s, and more especially to Mukden railway incident of 18th September 1931 九一八事變|九一八事变 and subsequent Japanese annexation of Manchuria
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
